message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest a fungal infection, possibly tinea capitis and tinea pedis, and the most accurate test would be a culture in Sabouraud liquid medium to identify the specific type of fungus causing the infection. Wood's lamp can also be used to identify some types of fungal infections but it is not as accurate as culture. KOH preparation of scalp scraping can also be used but it may not identify all types of fungi. CBC and total serum IgE are not specific tests for fungal infections, although they may be useful in helping to rule out other causes of the rash.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination suggest a fungal infection, specifically tinea capitis on the scalp and tinea pedis on the feet. Culture in Sabouraud liquid medium is the most accurate test for diagnosing a fungal infection. Wood's lamp is used to diagnose fungal infections in hair or skin that fluoresce under ultraviolet light, but it is not specific to all types of fungus. KOH preparation of scalp scraping can also diagnose a fungal infection, but it is less accurate than culture. A CBC and total serum IgE is not specific to fungal infections and would not be helpful in this case.
